name: Knight Of The Throne: Fighter 10/ Rogue 5/ CoT 15
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This is a role-playing build that resembles the classic medieval knight. It's not the lawful good type but actually more the real part (thus part rogue) and uses charisma as a prime stat alongside strength of course. The build is made with the (AMIA PW) in mind, although it's value should apply to all modules since it is a classic class combo and it's strengths are well known by all. As for the build, all the known values are here, namely more combat options than you can count for, full tumble ranks and UMD, saves are in the stratosphere, damage is solid rock, armour class is as good as it gets e.t.c.
And as for the Charisma value, you will find it surprisingly powerful since the 15th lvl of Divine Wrath in the limited 30 lvl environment is quite powerful, and it also serves both the role-playing aspect of the build and it's fun factor.

1st Note:

You can actually optimize one single stat in this build, namely the Dexterity from 12 to 8, in order to further enhance your Charisma or your Constitution score, but since this is a role playing build i choose not to do this. The option is there though and as we know getting to 12 Dexterity for optimal armour class in full plate is piece of cake in most environments. If you do this, i suggest you put your additional points into Charisma, especially if you play in AMIA PW, since this is also affects the duration of the powerful "Purge The Infidel" feat.

2nd Note:

As you see below, there are two Skiill Focus (SF) feats in the build that i have put them towards Discipline as befits a knight and UMD to get the 35 ranks for failure-less 9th lvl scroll-casting. In AMIA PW though it might be a good alternative to put those SF's into Craft: Armour and Craft: Weapon skills. If you do that, then modify your skills accordingly. There is a slight excess in skill points for exactly that reason
Knight Of The Throne
(Fighter 10/ Rogue 5/ CoT 15)



 
RACE: Human

ALIGNMENT: LN (Smite proof) [Any non-evil]

PLAYABILITY: PvM 1-40

STARTING/ ENDING STATS:
STR – 15 (26)
DEX – 12
CON –14
INT –  14
WIS – 08
CHA – 14

Hit Points: 370

Skill Points: 213 

Concentration: 33 (35)
Disable Traps: 24 (25)
Discipline: 33 (44)
Heal: 7 (6)
Open Locks: 4 (5)
Search: 26 (30) 26 (28)
Spellcraft: 13 (15) cc
Tumble: 30 (31)
UMD: 30 (35)

Saving Throws (Fort/Ref/Will): 27/ 26/ 18 → 30/ 29/ 21 (saves Vs spells)

Naked/ Armoured AC: (20/ 31) 19/30 (Full Plate Armour And Knight Shield) 

Armoured AC in Expertise/ Improved Expertise Stance: (36/ 41) 35/40

BAB: 24 (Four Attacks)

AB: +36/ +31/ +26/ +21 (Bastard Sword)
AB, ranged: +26/+21/+16/+11

DMG: 1D10 +14 / 17-20 X2 (Bastard Sword) 

Spellcasting: UMD Full Ranks 

Divine Wrath 1/ Day: +7 Attack/ +7 Dmg/ +7 all Saves/ 10 Damage Reduction Vs +2 Weapons 

Purge the Infidel 1/ Day: +15 Divine Damage Vs all of Different Aligment (AMIA)

OR Smite Evil 1/ Day: +2 (+8) Attack/ +15 Damage  Vs Evil Foes

Lay On Hands: 30 (120) Hit Points Of Positive Energy


LEVELING GUIDE:

01) Rogue (01): Luck Of Heroes, Expertise
02) Fighter (01): WP: Exotic
03) Fighter (02): WF: Bastard Sword, Knockdown
04) Fighter (03): STR+1
05) Fighter (04): WS: Bastard Sword

09) Champion Of Throne (01): Power Attack
10) Champion Of Throne (02): Cleave
11) Champion Of Throne (03):
12) Rogue (03): (SF: Discipline) STR+1, SkF: UMD**
13) Champion Of Throne (04): Improved Expertise
14) Champion Of Throne (05):
15) Champion Of Throne (06): (SF: UMD) SkF: Discipline, Called Shot
16) Champion Of Throne (07): STR+1
17) Rogue (04):
18) Champion Of Throne (08): Toughness, Improved Power Attack
19) Champion Of Throne (09):
20) Fighter (07): STR+1

22) Fighter (08): EWS: Bastard Sword
23) Champion Of Throne (11):
24) Champion Of Throne (12): STR+1, Great STR [2]
25) Champion Of Throne (13):
26) Champion Of Throne (14): Armour Skin
27) Rogue (05): Great STR [3]
28) Champion Of Throne (15):STR+1
29) Fighter (09):
30) Fighter (10): Great STR [4], Epic Prowess
**Note: Skill Focus: UMD can only be taken by rogue or bard classes

Skill Schedule

01: Disable Trap(4), Heal(4), Open Lock(4), Search(4), Spellcraft(2), Tumble(4), UMD(4), Save(16)
02: Concentration(5), Discipline(5), Save(11)

SPECIAL NOTES: 

* Cleave
* Evasion

edit: per Hip 20160527 (corrections/additions of missing info, in red)

posts.author: Pelagius
posts.content:
Is luck of heroess really that good?

I always though it to be a bit underwhelming (a whole feat for a +1 to saves don't seem like a huge tradeoff to me, specially on a build like this with such high saves by default).

I'm asking out of ignorance, though, not critizicing.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: No, it is not that good, but when you have taken all the feats you could possibly want (improved expertise, improved knockdown, improved power-attack, blind-fight etc) and still remain with an available choice, then adding plus one to all your saves can't hurt either. Besides it fits with the build and the image of the heroic knight. D&D 3.5 made this feat much better (to the point of auto-inclusion) by adding +1 luck bonus to your AC as well. Ask my players, they all take it if they can.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: This is also a testament to this certain combination of classes, there is nothing it can't do. And you always end up with feats to spare and awesome saves and skills, all these and still incredibly friendly for the amateur player or veteran alike with no playability sacrificed in the process.

posts.author: Pelagius
posts.content: I like this build a lot. I think I'm gonna save it somewhere on my computer and take it trough a set of modules. perhaps SoU+HoTU when I feel like replaying them.

posts.author: Pelagius
posts.content:
Well, I've been giving this build a shot and I must say that either I'm doing something horribly wrong or this toon is meant to be played at level 30 alone. I've gone through SoU countless times and never had I so much trouble staying alive with my "unoptimized" builds.

This guy couldn't hit the broad side of a barn to save his life!

I'm surprised and not in the good way.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Well, you must be doing something wrong then, because math does not lie.

Let me explain that in a more thorough way. The "Knight of the Throne" has an AB (attack bonus) of 36. Now, let's examine some other builds in that range. The "Arelith Dwarven Elite Guard" which is a weapon-master by the way, has also an AB of 36, the "Arelith Barbarian" which is a Barbarian-Fighter has an AB of 34, the "Ghost" which is a weapon-master with maximum human strength reaches 38 AB, and even your own "Divine Smiter" which is a level forty build and you said yourself that "he is a full AB progression build, so his AB should be fine" ends in 36 AB. I can find countless other examples from the old ECB archives for level thirty builds or from our own forum through builds we have made for Arelith/ AMIA/ Modules, but you get the idea of what I am saying.

Let's focus on your problem now and try to understand why is this happening. First thing is that you start as a rogue instead of a "fighting" class. Second thing is that you get your "weapon focus" on the third level. Lastly, you start with fifteen strength instead of sixteen for example. All of the above plus the relatively slow start of SoU seem to have contributed to your overall sluggish experience with the game. Understand though, that all of these had their purpose when we are talking about an optimized build, with the exception of lowish (starting) strength that is a result of the role-playing orientation of the build.

What can be done on such an occasion, from your part:

a) Quit playing the build and starting another more suited to your needs.
b) Looking at the build first to understand it, then shift two points from dexterity to strength, in order to make it slightly stronger in the beginning.
c) Simply keep playing and "trust" in the build to short itself out.
d) Ask for a solution in the ECB forum, explaining your problem and the guys here, myself included, will respond to you as soon as possible.

What can be done to "Fix" the problem for those who want a stronger start and/or build out of this:

a) The solution is pretty simple if you read the preface of the build. Simply optimize your stats to look like this:
Str17(28) Dex(8) Con(14) Int(13) Wis(8) Cha(14)
Then change your feat order in the first levels to this:
01) Fighter (01): Exotic Weapons, WF: Bastard Sword, Luck of Heroes
02) Rogue (01):
03) Fighter (02): Expertise, Knockdown
...
The end result of these changes is that you will have to omit the Concentration skill (small loss) and some additional skill points (take from Spellcraft) but on the other hand you will start with a much stronger AB (+3) and end in a final 37 AB for the Knight of the Throne which puts him into the "exceptional" territory for a build of this kind. Should I were to extend the Knight to forty levels he would end up easily in 45 AB with Dev Critical on top of that. He is a strong build without a doubt.

Now, you have to understand that this is the internet and the medium does not convey the tone of your words, so you will have to be more thoughtful of your reactions/words. Posting in a "threatening" manner will get you nothing, no matter how "frustrated" you might be. In the end, I am doing this for free, wasting my own time, out of my love for the game and the fellow members of the ECB, I do not need responses like these.

posts.author: demoix
posts.content: Any suggestions for 30-40 levels? It became best build for me, I'm using it in every module and enjoying.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Sure, it's a simple matter to extend the build to forty levels.

1) Keep pumping STR at levels 33, 36 & 39 with Great Strengths
2) Take an additional 7 levels of CoT & 2 levels of Ftr & 1 level in Rog (Final Split CoT 22/ Ftr 12/ Rog 6)
3) Take Dev Crit with your additional feats from both CoT & Ftr, assuming you've taken Great Cleave pre-epic OR invest on a secondary weapon for modules that don't allow it.

You end up with 45AB/ Dev Crit/ knight with full tumble, umd & awesome saves.

Edit: Where are my manners... Welcome to the ECB demoix!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
For the sake of clarity to the less proficient among us...

Presumably STR also gets bumps at 32, 36 and 40 as well (giving 32 in all). An honest question, though: would there be any merit in leaving STR at 30 and bumping CHA by 2 points (thinking about CoT stuff)?

If taking Great Cleave, would that be to replace Imp PA? Also, I don't seem to see Imp Crit pre-epic - was that a deliberate choice, or might it be worthwhile dropping one of the Skill Focuses?

And I'm guessing the final Rogue level is at 37.

Cheers!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
a) Yes, STR all the way. Giving 32 in the RP iteration of the build & 34 in the PG version (assuming you instead started with the 17/ 13/ 14/ 14 stat spread).

b) No, IPA can stay, instead replace the two SF feats if you are not playing in AMIA Persistent World OR similar for Gr Cleave & IC.

c) I do not advise taking off from Strength unless the module/ PW that you're playing the build has some enhancements for CoT that justify the heavier investment in Charisma.

d) Correct, the final rogue level is at 37th in order to max-out Tumble & UMD.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you want Dev Crit, you MUST have Imp Crit.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yes, I mentioned this in point b, (IC stands for Improved Critical).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Since your post right before mine was at the top of a new page, I didn't see it before typing my post.  I have noticed this happening to me a lot lately.  I need tp try to pay more attention to whether the page I am viewing is the last page.

posts.author: Dingpot
posts.content: Love this build, it's so versatile. Took me through OC and HOTU and Sands of Fate 1 as a beginner.  Just wondered whether in WoG you would keep the SF in discipline and UMD or take Gr Cleave and Imp Crit so you can have dev crit later on? I just noted your comment about worlds similar to AIMA needing the SF, but knowing nothing about AIMA and still a beginner on WoG I could use the advice?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hi Dingpot,

In general, if you have UMD on a build & you play on WoG, it's better to just wear these nice boots from the Duergar mines (Azak-Zill?), there's literally no downside in doing that. The high discipline for AMIA PW was not specific but the craft focuses were. IIRC, in AMIA you also had better returns on your CoT levels, too. Back to WoG now, if I would go against something tough (including Drows), I would opt for immunity to KD because there's also that "devastating" Bigby's VI/VII (one of the two) that sits you on your butt & ignores your discipline check. Of course, it can be done anyway, but you need beforehand knowledge, good reflexes & a bit of luck, too. I remember doing the old Drow Wizards (the ones with real true sight 24/7 on) with just a pure Barbarian (TR, no dev-crit), but I had to time everything down to the last detail & do a lot of corners-charge-IKD-drink invis pot, etc.

Anyways, a high discipline will do fine unless you are up against really tough opponents that will just start to spam IKD & Bigby's on you, there it's better to be completely immune to that status effect since one mistake can mean you need to restart the whole thing again. And as for the build, I would change the two skill focusses for improved critical & great cleave & then go for devastating critical (early).

Hope that helps ;)
